papers.title: Interpretable and Accurate Identification of Job Seekers at Risk of Long-Term Unemployment: Explainable ML-Based Profiling
Identification of latest trends and current developments in methods to profile jobseekers in European public employment services : final report
Variational Bayes survival analysis for unemployment modelling
papers.summary: The proposed model uses a deep artificial neural network (ANN) as a non-linear hazard function that is used to determine the employment probability over time for each individual on the record.

papers.title: Structuring the scattered literature on algorithmic profiling in the case of unemployment through a systematic literature review
papers.venue: International journal of sociology and social policy
papers.summary: The literature review shows that APPES constitutes an emerging field of research encompassed by four strands and associated research disciplines, thus suggesting that the practices and effects of algorithmic profiling are multidimensional and dynamic.

papers.title: Predicting the probability of long-term unemployment and recalibrating Ireland's Statistical Profiling Model
papers.authors: S. McGuinness,P. Redmond,E. Kelly,Konstantina I. Maragkou

papers.title: (in) Accuracy in Algorithmic Profiling of the Unemployed – An Exploratory Review of Reporting Standards
papers.summary: It is demonstrated that the current method of reporting a single measure for accuracy (usually a percentage) inflates the capabilities of the technology in a peculiar way, and so falsely identify those who prove to be frictionally unemployed as likely to be LTU, having important implications for the effectiveness of spending on ALMPs.

papers.title: MODERNISING PES THROUGH SUPPORTIVE DATA AND IT STRATEGIES

Survival analysis as semi-supervised multi-target regression for time-to-employment prediction using oblique predictive clustering trees
Perfilado psicosocial para la intervención socioeducativa en los servicios sociales
papers.venue: Interdisciplinaria Revista de Psicología y Ciencias Afines

papers.title: Machine Learning and Subjective Assessments by Unemployed Workers and Their Caseworkers
papers.authors: G. J. Berg,Max Kunaschk,Julia Lang,G. Stephan,Arne Uhlendorﬀ
papers.summary: The results suggest that caseworker assessments contain information not captured by the machine learning algorithm, and random-forest machine learning methods are used to predict individual LTU.

papers.title: Using Machine Learning to Create an Early Warning System for Welfare Recipients
papers.summary: Predictive models of income support receipt intensities for any payment enrolee in the Australian social security system between 2014 and 2018 are developed to improve the detection of long-term income support recipients accruing a welfare cost nearly AUD 1 billion higher than individuals identified in the current system.

papers.title: Do Red-Flagged Clients Exit Social Assistance Earlier than Others? The Case of the Finnish Social Assistance System
Fairness in vulnerable attribute prediction on social media
papers.summary: The results show that careful assessment of fairness metrics should be considered when AI models are employed for policymaking, and a framework based on an adaptive threshold for gender is proposed.

papers.title: Bias as Boundary Object: Unpacking The Politics Of An Austerity Algorithm Using Bias Frameworks
papers.venue: Conference on Fairness, Accountability and Transparency

papers.title: Profiles Among Women Without a Paid Job and Social Benefits: An Intersectional Perspective Using Dutch Population Register Data
papers.authors: Lea Kröner,Deni Mazrekaj,Tanja van der Lippe,A. Poortman

papers.title: "You Got to Make the Numbers Work": Negotiating Managerial Reforms in the Provision of Employment Support Service
papers.authors: D. Rudman,R. Aldrich,J. Grundy,M. Stone,S. Huot,Awish Aslam

papers.title: The stealth legitimization of a controversial policy tool: Statistical profiling in French Public Employment Service
Algorithmic Profiling in Public Employment Services: a Systematic Review on the Effects on Caseworkers and Jobseekers
papers.authors: EasyChair Preprint,Mareike Sirman-Winkler,Daria Szafran,Sonja Mei Wang
papers.summary: The understanding of the role of digital tools for the work of street-level bureaucrats and for citizens is enhanced by systematically identifying and compiling a differentiated picture of the impact and risks of algorithmic profiling.

papers.title: Electric Dreams of Welfare in the 4th Industrial Revolution: An Actor-network Investigation and Genealogy of an Algorithm
COMPARATIVE STUDY ON WESTERN BALKANS PES PERFORMANCE BENCHLEARNING AMONG WESTERN BALKAN PUBLIC EMPLOYMENT SERVICES
Statistical profiling in public employment services
papers.venue: OECD Social, Employment and Migration Working Papers
papers.summary: An overview on profiling tools currently used throughout the OECD is presented, considerations for the development of such tools, and some insights into the latest developments such as using “click data” on job searches and advanced machine learning techniques are presented.

papers.title: Implications of technological change and austerity for employability in urban labour markets
papers.summary: A critical review of the literature on ICT and its relation to, and implications for, employability in a context of austerity is presented and those aspects of employability where ICT plays a key role are highlighted.

papers.title: Using Artificial Intelligence to classify Jobseekers: The Accuracy-Equity Trade-off
papers.summary: It is argued that it is critical that policymakers and caseworkers understand the inherent trade-offs of profiling models, and consider the limitations when integrating these models in daily operations, and a graphical tool is developed to visualize the accuracy-equity trade-off in order to facilitate policy discussions.

papers.title: Fairness in Algorithmic Profiling: A German Case Study
papers.authors: C. Kern,Ruben L. Bach,H. Mautner,F. Kreuter
papers.summary: This study compares and evaluates statistical models for predicting job seekers' risk of becoming long-term unemployed with respect to prediction performance, fairness metrics, and vulnerabilities to data analysis decisions, and highlights that different classification policies have very different fairness implications.

papers.title: How to Optimize the Job Search Process: Development and Validation of the Job Search Quality Scale
papers.authors: Edwin A. J. van Hooft,Greet van Hoye,Sarah M van den Hee

papers.title: Algorithmic Tools in Public Employment Services: Towards a Jobseeker-Centric Perspective
papers.venue: Conference on Fairness, Accountability and Transparency
papers.authors: Kristen M. Scott,Sonja Mei Wang,Milagros Miceli,Pieter Delobelle,Karolina Sztandar-Sztanderska,Bettina Berendt
papers.summary: It is argued that the limitations and risks of current systems cannot be addressed through minor adjustments but require a more fundamental change to the role of PES.

papers.title: Functions, Utilities and Limitations: A Scoping Study of Decision Support Algorithms in Social Work
The Work Profiler: Revision and maintenance of a profiling tool for the recently unemployed in the Netherlands
papers.authors: Martijn A. Wijnhoven,E. Dusseldorp,M. Guiaux,Harriët Havinga

papers.title: “We try to empower them” - Exploring Future Technologies to Support Migrant Jobseekers
papers.venue: Conference on Fairness, Accountability and Transparency
papers.authors: Sonja Mei Wang,Kristen M. Scott,Margarita Artemenko,Milagros Miceli,Bettina Berendt
papers.summary: A software-based project is proposed that expands existing job taxonomies into a coordinated resource combining job characteristics, required competencies, and soft skills to support multiple informational tools for jobseekers.

papers.title: The impact of modeling decisions in statistical profiling
papers.authors: Ruben L. Bach,Christoph Kern,H. Mautner,Frauke Kreuter
papers.summary: This work evaluates regression and machine-learning models for predicting job-seekers’ risk of becoming long-term unemployed using German administrative labor market data and shows that training an accurate prediction model is just one element in a series of design and modeling decisions, each having notable effects that span beyond predictive accuracy.

papers.title: When Small Decisions Have Big Impact: Fairness Implications of Algorithmic Profiling Schemes
papers.authors: C. Kern,Ruben L. Bach,H. Mautner,F. Kreuter
papers.summary: It is shown that despite achieving high prediction performance on average, profiling models can be considerably less accurate for vulnerable social subgroups, and called for rigorous auditing processes before such models are put to practice.

The digital transformation of public employment services across Latin America and the Caribbean
papers.summary: This document provides relevant information on the opportunities and challenges of digitalization in public employment services in Latin America and the Caribbean across these dimensions, as well as their level of digital maturity.

papers.title: Differential pricing in contracted out employment programmes: review of international evidence

Qualitative Mismatches
papers.summary: The role of employment agencies in reducing qualitative mismatches as well as other policies that would improve the operation of the labor market are considered.
